message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Test {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        String expression = "This is a test string";
        StringTokenizer sTokenizer = new StringTokenizer(expression);
        StringBuilder remainingString = new StringBuilder();

        // operations with some of the tokens here
        sTokenizer.nextToken(); // consume first token

        while (sTokenizer.hasMoreTokens()) {
            remainingString.append(sTokenizer.nextToken());
            if (sTokenizer.hasMoreTokens()) {
                remainingString.append(" "); // add space between tokens
            }
        }

        System.out.println(remainingString.toString());
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer.nextToken() method does not provide a way to retrieve the remaining string as a single token. However, you can achieve this by using a loop to concatenate the remaining tokens into a single string. In the provided code, after consuming the first token, a StringBuilder is used to concatenate the remaining tokens into a single string. The if condition inside the loop is used to add a space between tokens, as StringTokenizer.nextToken() removes the delimiters.
